page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: Farming in this area is mostly agricultural with small amounts of live stock usually attached to an agricultural farm. The livestock varies from, chickens (kept for eggs) and chickens and turkeys bred and raised for consumption, through to sheep (lamb), for consumption and fleece, cows for milk, bullocks (beef) for consumption, pigs for consumption. Some livestock farming is intensive or battery. Agricultural land is extensive with subsidies given for growing specific crops, hence the main crop for this area being wheat followed by oil seed rape, barley, potatoes, peas , beans and oats. the land is all mechanically ploughed, sown and harvested on a continuous basis. The average farm being 300 acres with 2 employees, some temporary staff empoloyed at harvest time.
